recipes.name: Pepperoni Pizza
recipes.shortDesc: Its a dish everyones expecting on the holidays, but its so easy to make, you can serve any day.

ingredients.ingredientText: cups all-purpose flour, or more as needed
cups very warm water (120 degrees F to 130 degrees F)

steps.text: For sauce: Combine all sauce ingredients with 1/2 cup water in a medium bowl; set aside for flavors to develop while making crust. Freeze remaining paste .

For crusts: Combine 2 cups of flour with the dry yeast, sugar and salt. Add the water and oil and mix until well blended (about 1 minute). Gradually add enough remaining flour slowly, until a soft, sticky dough ball is formed.
Knead for about 4 minutes, on a floured surface, until dough is smooth and elastic. Add more flour, if needed. (If using RapidRise(R) Yeast, let dough rest, covered, for 10 minutes.)
Divide dough in half. Pat each half (with floured hands) into a 12-inch greased pizza pan OR roll dough to fit pans.
For pizzas: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Top crusts with sauce, pepperoni and cheese.
Bake for 18 to 20 minutes until crusts are browned and cheese is bubbly. For best results, rotate pizza pans between top and bottom oven racks halfway through baking.

userReviews.title: I love that its an entire meal!
userReviews.text: The pizza was scrumptious!!! I used olive oil for the dough (My KitchenAid mixer did most of the mixing) and I baked the pizza on a Pampered chef Stoneware. I added about 3 tablespoon of pizza...

userReviews.title: Great and easy!
userReviews.text: I put pork sausage on after I have cooked and sliced it green peppers in fact just put what you would like to eat my son put broccoli florets on his the pizza crust is very good will use this cr...

userReviews.title: Yummy for over 40 years
userReviews.text: Absolutely love it! Made two out of it! Added bell peppers to one and left the other as mozzarella and pepperoni . Mixed the dough with olive oil. Turned out perfect! Great recipe!

recipes.name: Meat Dish and Vegetables
recipes.shortDesc: Its a dish everyones expecting on the holidays, but its so easy to make, you can serve any day.

ingredients.ingredientText: pounds potato(about 6 medium potatoes), cut into quarters
6 medium carrot, cut into 2-inch pieces (about 3 cups)

steps.text: Thoroughly mix the beef, 1/2 cup soup, bread crumbs, Worcestershire, black pepper, egg and onion in a large bowl. Shape the beef mixture into an 8 x 4-inch loaf in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan. Arrange the potatoes and carrots around meatloaf in the baking pan.
Bake at 375°F. for 30 minutes. Spoon off any fat.

Stir the remaining soup and water in a small bowl. Spoon the soup mixture over the meatloaf and vegetables. Bake for 30 minutes or until the meatloaf is cooked through and the vegetables are fork-tender.

userReviews.title: I love that its an entire meal!
userReviews.text: I always use oatmeal (quick cook or regular) instead of bread crumbs. I find the oatmeal takes on the look and mouth feel of the meat after it cooks. More fiber is a great plus. I mix a bit of hot sauce in my tomato...

recipes.name: Mom’s Zucchini Bread
recipes.shortDesc: Really, really good and moist- my kids eat it as quickly as I can make it. Bread will freeze well, and keep in refrigerator for weeks.

steps.text: Grease and flour two 8 x 4 inch pans. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Sift flour, salt, baking powder, soda, and cinnamon together in a bowl.

Beat eggs, oil, vanilla, and sugar together in a large bowl. Add sifted ingredients to the creamed mixture, and beat well. Stir in zucchini and nuts until well combined. Pour batter into prepared pans.
Bake for 40 to 60 minutes, or until tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan on rack for 20 minutes. Remove bread from pan, and completely cool.

userReviews.title: I love that its an entire meal!
userReviews.text: This is my MASTER zucchini recipe. No need to look further. Ive tried 3 recipes from this site, and this one is the BEST. I do half and half oil/applesauce and subsititute and reduce to 2 cup...

userReviews.title: Great and easy!
userReviews.text: I had a large zucchini so I doubled the recipe. I used 1 1/2 C oil and 3 1/2 C sugar. I though the result was good, but not fantastic. Next time, I will try the chocolate zucchini bread versi...

recipes.name: Spaghetti Sauce with Ground Beef
recipes.shortDesc: This recipe has been handed down from my mother. It is a family favorite and will not be replaced! (Definite husband pleaser!)

steps.text: Combine ground beef, onion, garlic, and green pepper in a large saucepan. Cook and stir until meat is brown and vegetables are tender. Drain grease.

Bake at 375°F. for 30 minutes. Spoon off any fat.Stir diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, and tomato paste into the pan. Season with oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer spaghetti sauce for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.

userReviews.title: I love that its an entire meal!
userReviews.text: I have used this for years. I have played around with it a little and found that a teaspoon of sugar cuts the acidity of the tomatoes. And if you want to make it taste a little richer, stir in a...

recipes.name: Mushroom and Ricotta Bruschetta
recipes.shortDesc: This appetizer is super simple and tasty. Cook the mushrooms while you prepare the toasted bread, and youll be serving these up in no time.

steps.text: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Mix ricotta, egg, lemon zest, 1/2 teaspoon salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes in a bowl until smooth.
Place toasted bread slices on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon olive oil and evenly divide ricotta mixture atop 4 bread slices.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is browned, about 12 minutes.

Heat butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir mushrooms in mixture until browned, 5 to 6 minutes. Add green onions; cook and stir until softened, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir marsala wine into mixture and cook until reduced by half, about 1 minute.
Reduce heat to medium-low. Add chicken stock and lemon juice to skillet; cook until liquid has evaporated. Reduce heat to low. Stir in parsley and butter. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Spoon mushroom mixture equally atop 4 slices of ricotta-topped bread slices.

userReviews.title: I love that its an entire meal!
userReviews.text: I toasted the bread only until slightly dry (no color to the bread), spread on the ricotta mixture, and after 9 minutes in the oven, they were already browned more than I would have liked and ev...

userReviews.text: It was a bit too much egg for my taste. Had to add a lot more seasoning to the mushrooms just to take the edge off of the ricotta mixture. You might want to toast the bread a little before addin...

recipes.name: Blueberry Muffin Cake
recipes.shortDesc: A delicious breakfast coffee cake that tastes like your favorite blueberry muffins.

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray an 8x8-inch baking pan with cooking spray.
Toss blueberries and 1/2 cup of flour in a small bowl until blueberries are coated. Set aside.

Beat together sugar and oil with an electric mixer in a large bowl. Add milk, egg, and vanilla extract. Mix remaining 1 cup flour, baking powder, and salt in a small bowl. Add flour mixture to sugar mixture; mix until just combined. fold in blueberry mixture. Pour batter into the prepared baking pan.
Mix together brown sugar, 1/3 cup flour, and cinnamon in a bowl. Cut in butter until topping mixture is crumbly. Sprinkle on top of the cake batter.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool before serving.

userReviews.title: I love that its an entire meal!
userReviews.text: One thing I will probably change next time is Ill make a double recipe of the crust. I made it in a wider pan so it didnt quite cover it. Other than that it turned out very well. Not too swee...

userReviews.title: Great and easy!
userReviews.text: Theyre done when YOU say! Cook them a little less, youll get moist and dense. Overcook and you have a dry cake. Deeeeelishus!!!!

userReviews.title: Great and easy!
